instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not fully booting
threads.message:
Arrived with liquid damage on <CAPACITOR>C5008</CAPACITOR> <CAPACITOR>C5007</CAPACITOR> <CAPACITOR>C5002</CAPACITOR> <CHIP>U3710</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q1920</TRANSISTOR>. Replaced everything and board was fully booting into OS. Appeared to be fixed.

After running OS for a bit board suddenly died. Now when trying to turn on the fan spins on and off twice but nothing else happens, not the normal on and off 3 times. Vcore present at 1.7V

Tried known good bios with no change.

Should should be checked next???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not fully booting
threads.message:
Did you try SMC bypass mode?

Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and traces.
Clean/remove J6100.

Just in case, reball SMC and heat CPU to 180-200 degrees.
